items.title: Bedford Falls: Music That Turns Moments IntoยMemories
items.summary: Formed in 2014, the band has emerged as one of the leading forces in the Georgian music scene.
items.body: If you ever find yourself at a Bedford Fallsโ live show, the first thing youโll notice is the unmistakable connection between the band and the audience. Their performances are defined by shared energy, where the crowd becomes part of the act – a fifth member of the band, turning every song into a collective chorus. And their music, free from genre boundaries, leaves you no choice but to sing along. Formed in 2014, Bedford Falls — Dato (vocals), Mikho (guitar), Migro (bass) and Sandro (drums and backing vocals) — has grown into one of the leading forces in Georgiaโs music scene. Inspired by Frank Capraโs classic movie Itโs a Wonderful Life, the band took its name from the fictional town, where the story unfolds – a place where the lives of its residents are deeply intertwined, where community, kindness and human connections shape everyday city life. โWe were discussing, before the interview, what weโd answer if you asked us why Bedford Falls: because we believed โitโs a wonderful life,โโ they say, talking about the bandโs name, which, at the beginning was a challenge for listeners to remember, however today itโs more associated with the band rather than the โฆ

items.title: Before I knew it, ChatGPT went from a useful tool to time-wasting a habit
items.summary: AI became my new endless doom-scroll without me noticing.
items.body: Credit: Calvin Wankhede / Android Authority There are plenty of mixed opinions on AIโs potential benefits and harms , but Iโll admit Iโve been somewhat hooked on it from day one. I tend to dive deep into subjects with AI for short bursts that might last hours or on-and-off for a few days, and then drift away for weeks or more when life gets busy with things that are obviously more important. Slowly but surely, though, I realized I was doing less and less when it came to other personal interests. While my AI use never disrupted my real-life obligations or relationships, it was starting to cannibalize my hobbies. Recently, I started scrolling through my massive ChatGPT log entries. Some were simple entertainment, and others were deep thoughts that frankly got a bit heavy. There were more interactions than Iโd ever care to count. Thatโs when the thought hit me: โHas this become my new doom scroll?โ I started wondering how I got to that point, how much time I was wasting, and why it felt so addictive. Eventually, I took a deeper look at my AI usage patterns and then took a step back.

At the time, it was heavily focused on the Apple ecosystem, but now that the device is finally out, itโs turned into so much more. Sure, it still has MagSafe magnets, but now so do Pixel phones. items.title: The iPhone 16e proves that Apple will never beat Android at budget phones
items.summary: I'm a sucker for a good value, but this phone just makes me feel like a sucker.
items.body: At this point, thereโs little doubt in my mind: Android will always rule the affordable smartphone game. Itโs not because Apple hasnโt tried, nor is it because every cheap Android phone is really that good, but rather because I donโt think a cheap iPhone works anymore. At least, it doesnโt work in the way that Apple keeps trying to present it. Put another way, the iPhone 16e is the least sensible phone of 2025, and Iโm at a loss to understand why Apple thought it was a good idea. Iโve reviewed it alongside all of its closest Android rivals, and I think itโs best served as a reminder that copying Apple isnโt always a good idea. Hereโs what I think it gets so wrong in the face of so many good Android options.

items.title: Watching video on Android Auto is far more complicated than it should be
items.summary: It's theoretically possible, but it's just not practical right now.
items.body: I want to give Google fair praise; Android Auto is a surprisingly versatile platform. Itโs primarily tasked with mirroring phone functionality and information to the dashboards of supported cars. The intention is to make driversโ lives a little easier, giving them quick access to contacts for calls and messages, music controls, and navigation information. However, for those of us who spend plenty of time waiting in the car, thereโs one feature thatโs seemingly missing from this list: video playback. The concept is simple: my car has a screen, so surely I should be able to watch a video on it. While it is technically possible, it comes with strict and awkward limitations.

items.title: I love the OnePlus 15, but here are 5 reasons Iโd recommend the OnePlus 15R instead
items.summary: But one easily outweighs the rest.
items.body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority OnePlus typically launches its flagship with an R-branded companion. The latter is characterized by slightly less impactful specifications, including a relatively dull display, a less appealing camera, or a generation-old processor. This year, however, the OnePlus 15R has earned a separate launch, independent of the OnePlus 15 โs shadow. Thatโs because the gap between the two phones is closing, as they share several features on their spec sheets, and these similarities help elevate the OnePlus 15R closer to the status of a flagship Android phone โ even though itโs still a flagship-killer at heart . My colleague Joe Maring reviewed the OnePlus 15R and wasnโt quite convinced it is the appropriate update to the 13R, especially given the downgraded cameras, OxygenOS 16โs shift towards an iOS-like aesthetic, and a $100 price bump. While I donโt disagree, I view the OnePlus 15R as packing all the essential bits from the flagship 15, especially for those craving performance and longevity. And if youโre not looking for the swankiest of features, the OnePlus 15R may be worth your consideration.

items.title: Rufus Wainwright, Lucius & Lord Huron Added to L.A. Wildfire Anniversary BenefitยConcert
items.summary: The John C. Reilly-hosted event will be held on Jan. 7 at the Pasadena Civic Auditorium.
items.body: The Concert for Altadena has expanded its lineup ahead of the benefit supporting Californians affected by last yearโs deadly wildfires. Rufus Wainwright, Lucius, Lord Huron and Taboo of the Black Eyed Peas have joined the roster for the Jan. 7, 2026, show at the Pasadena Civic Auditorium. The one-night-only concert, benefiting those impacted by the Eaton Fire, will be hosted by Altadena resident John C. Reilly, whose home was destroyed in the blaze. Organized by the band Dawes , the event will also feature previously announced performers, including Brandon Flowers of The Killers and Brad Paisley. Other artists on the lineup include Eric Krasno, Aloe Blacc, Jackson Browne, Judith Hill, Jenny Lewis, Mandy Moore, Stephen Stills, Everclear and Ozomatli. Proceeds will support the Altadena Builds Back Foundation , which helps rebuild homes destroyed in the fires. The Eaton Fire ravaged the region, killing 19 people, forcing 100,000 residents to flee, and leveling nearly 9,500 structures. “January 7th marks a year to the day that our sweet town got ravaged by the Eaton Fire,” Dawes wrote on Instagram in October. “Itโs gonna be a heavy night, but itโs going to be a beautโฆ

items.title: Google may finally reverse this controversial Quick Settings change
items.summary: Google may finally bring back the separate Wi-Fi and mobile data toggles in a future Android release.
items.body: With the release of Android 12 back in 2021, Google made a somewhat controversial change to the Quick Settings panel. Gone were the individual toggles for Wi-Fi and mobile data. In their place was a new, expandable Internet tile that housed the old mobile data and Wi-Fi toggles. The change aimed to simplify things for users, but it had the side effect of making it more tedious to toggle Wi-Fi and mobile data. Years after rolling out this change, though, Google may be on the verge of reversing it in a future update to Android 16 . Youโre reading the Authority Insights Newsletter , a weekly newsletter that reveals some new facet of Android that hasnโt been reported on anywhere else. items.title: How I turned Android 16โs Quick Settings into my smart home control center
items.summary: Google Home doesn't have this, but I found a very complicated workaround.
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority Android 16โs first major update made me fall back in love with Quick Settings. After Android 12 took away the smaller toggles and switched to the large pill-shaped buttons in the name of Material You, I started using Quick Settings less and less. See, any time a button is hidden away from my eyes and requires more than one or two swipes or taps, I just forget it exists. And this is what happened for me with Quick Settings on Android 12 to 15; I set up the ones I used the most up front and forgot about the rest. Android 16 QPR1 brought the ability to collapse each large pill into half its size and thus fit more toggles on one screen, and thatโs what I immediately did. I now had more space to try new things with Quick Settings, like launch apps or start actions inside apps, but I blanked out for a while, not finding the right way to use the extra space. That is, until I realized that the action I needed the most is to control my smart home in general, and my standing desk in particular.

items.summary: Samsung is rumored to use the in-house Exynos 2600 to power the Galaxy Z Flip 8.
items.body: TL;DR Samsung is reportedly exploring chip options for the Galaxy Z Flip 8, and the newly-announced Exynos 2600 is the leading contender. The companyโs brand-new Exynos 2600 is the worldโs first 2nm smartphone chip, which brings major performance increases compared to the Exynos 2500. If Samsung uses the Exynos 2600 for the Galaxy Z Flip 8, it would be the second straight year a Galaxy flip phone used an in-house processor. Samsungโs next in-house flagship mobile processor, the Exynos 2600 , was just officially announced as the worldโs first smartphone chip built using the 2nm Gate-All-Around (GAA) manufacturing process. Itโs rumored to be powering select Samsung Galaxy S26 models in some global markets, but there may be another upcoming Samsung flagship using the chip. The Samsung Exynos 2600 might also power the Galaxy Z Flip 8, according to a new report. As reported by The Bell , Samsung could use the Exynos 2600 chip in the Galaxy Z Flip 8, which is set to arrive next summer (via 9to5Google ). The report cites unnamed industry sources, and says that Samsung is considering the Exynos 2600 for its next flip phone โ nothing has been decided yet.

With both song searches and voice input, weโre able to get responses from Google that contain voice output. Weโre also seeing a new floating button for continuing your search in AI Mode. Google gives us a ton of different ways to look up information, and the form in which it delivers those results can vary a lot based on how we choose to interact with it โ type a text search in your browser, and you get your results back as text. Use voice input for Gemini , and you get a voice response. But sometimes that doesnโt always work the way weโd expect, and today weโre checking out what could be some upcoming changes to how Google communicates with us in response to using its Pixel home screen widget . items.summary: As part of NASAโs SpaceX Crew-12 mission, four crew members from three space agencies will launch no earlier than Sunday, Feb. 15, 2026, to the International Space Station for a long-duration science expedition. NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway will serve as spacecraft commander and pโฆ
items.body: From left to right, NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway, ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev. Credit: NASA As part of NASAโs SpaceX Crew-12 mission, four crew members from three space agencies will launch no earlier than Sunday, Feb. 15, 2026, to the International Space Station for a long-duration science expedition. NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway will serve as spacecraft commander and pilot, respectively, and will be accompanied by ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev, who will both serve as mission specialists. Crew-12 will join Expedition 74 crew members currently aboard the space station. The flight is the 12th crew rotation with SpaceX to the orbiting laboratory as part of NASAโs Commercial Crew Program . Crew-12 will conduct scientific investigations and technology demonstrations to help prepare humans for future exploration missions to the Moon and Mars, as well as benefit people on Earth. This will be the second flight to the space station for Meir, who was selected as a NASA astronaut in 2013. The Caribou, Maine, native earned a bachelorโฆ

items.title: Sick of fake AI movie trailers on YouTube? Thereโs good news
items.summary: Two large AI movie trailer channels have been taken down.
items.body: TL;DR Two large YouTube channels that primarily published bootleg AI movie trailers have been banned. Screen Culture and HK Studio have been deplatformed for violating YouTubeโs policies about spam and metadata accuracy. Together, videos by the two channels had been viewed more than a billion times. Plenty of AI content has found a home on YouTube : fire up a fresh account, and youโll be seeing gen-AI videos within just a few rounds of recommendations. AI video in general is allowed on YouTube, of course, but some of it does run afoul of YouTubeโs policies โ and now, two major offenders have been booted from the platform. Deadline reports that YouTube has banned two large channels that had been peddling AI-generated movie trailers. The problem wasnโt the trailers themselves, but how they were presented: YouTube channels Screen Culture and KH Studio had been uploading a large quantity of AI movie trailers that werenโt clearly labeled, which YouTube says violates the platformโs policies on spam and misleading metadata.

The experimenting continues, and some viewers are about to see another switch-up. This time, YouTube is testing a new take on the Dislike button that affects both its placement and exact meaning. In a post on the Google Support forums , YouTube says itโs experimenting with folding โDislikeโ and โNot interestedโ into a single thumbs-down option for Shorts. Rather than sitting on the main video UI, the button will now be tucked away behind the three-dot menu. items.title: Is that video fake? Geminiโs new update aims to solve the AI slop problem

items.body: TL;DR Google has expanded Geminiโs detection capabilities, enabling users to upload videos to verify whether they were created or edited using Google AI. Gemini scans audio and visual tracks within the video for imperceptible SynthID watermarks, identifying specific segments of AI-generated content. While available globally for files up to 100MB, the tool only detects SynthID, meaning it cannot identify AI media from many other AI tools. AI slop has been the big trend of 2025. Wherever you look on the internet, there are AI-generated images and videos. AI tools have also become so good that it has become significantly challenging to distinguish a real photo or video from an AI-generated one. Google has recently introduced the ability to detect AI-generated images within the Gemini app , and the company is now expanding this capability to detect AI-generated videos as well. Emoji play a core role in how people communicate online, allowing us to express ourselves with playful images and symbols rather than just text. items.title: Turning off Nothingโs Lock Glimpse feature might actually make things worse
items.summary: Nothingโs Lock Glimpse still runs when disabled, with users flagging background activity that could hurt battery life.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Lock Glimpse debuted in Nothing OS 4.0 as an optional lock screen feature, but it is now raising concerns over battery drain. Itโs a system-level component, meaning it canโt be uninstalled without root access and can only be toggled off. Even when disabled, the system reportedly attempts to restart Lock Glimpse every few seconds, resulting in unnecessary background activity. Nothingโs latest software experiment is turning into an unexpected headache, and itโs testing the patience of some of the brandโs loyal fans. The trouble is with Lock Glimpse, a lock-screen feature in Nothing OS 4.0 , which started as an optional addition but is now sparking real concern about battery life. Lock Glimpse first appeared in beta builds of Nothing OS 4.0 . On paper, it sounds harmless enough. Nothing frames it as a discovery-focused lock screen experience. You wake your phone and see rotating images paired with short headlines, each linking out to a web article. The pitch is that it adds variety and context. The reality, according to many users , is that it feels a lot like ads wearing a minimalist disguise.

items.title: Stop using YouTubeโs incognito mode; this trick is better
items.summary: Why watch ads when you can have your Premium perks on a second account?
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority I often come across a quick search or video that Iโd rather watch in incognito on YouTube. Itโs usually related to a temporary interest or research โ planning for a trip, comparing products before a purchase, lots of work-related searches, quick current culture-related videos โ that I donโt want to be associated with my account history, so I donโt get similar recommendations for months down the line. I used to resort to YouTubeโs incognito mode in the app or on the web to watch these videos without leaving a trace for the pesky algorithm. A few years ago, I discovered a better and more versatile solution that gives me the separation and privacy of an incognito mode, while still keeping all the benefits and features Iโm used to. Since then, I havenโt opened Incognito once.

Somehow, it has become the go-to tablet against which all others are compared, and its name has become synonymous with the large-screen experience โ on par with Kleenex and Xerox in terms of recognition. items.title: Got 16 hours to kill? Streamers subject Samsung Galaxy Z Trifold to epic endurance test
items.summary: Watch Samsung's TriFold survive 25,000 folds in this durability test marathon.
items.body: TL;DR According to Samsung, the Galaxy Z TriFoldโs screen is rated for 200,000 folds, and some YouTubers are trying to test just that. Across two multi-hour streams, theyโve already clocked 25,000 open-and-close events. So far the screen has held up to the use, although thereโs still a long way to go. Whatโs the most desirable phone around right now? For a whole lot of reasons, smartphone fans this year have been intrigued by Samsungโs Galaxy Z TriFold . Right now, itโs still out of touch for most of us (we were lucky enough to score the hands-on time you can watch above) between restricted international availability, a sky-high price tag, and limited stock causing it to quickly sell out. Eventually that will change โ will you pick one up then? If youโve been thinking at all about it, or are just curious how a screen like this phoneโs holds up to repeated use, you are absolutely going to want to check out what a few South Korean YouTubers have been up to. Donโt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?
